title.rendered: Great Places to Travel by Yourself

content.rendered:
Sometimes you just need to get away. You don’t need the hassle of traveling with your family, and you don’t want the inconvenience of having to share a hotel room with your friends. Sometimes it is just nice to get away by yourself and enjoy some relaxing time getting refreshed and rejuvenated all alone. Unfortunately, there are not many places that advertise a great vacation getaway for one. It seems like the advertising companies are always trying to get you to go on a romantic vacation for two, or a fun vacation for your family. But if you’re looking for a place to go all on your own, here are a few suggestions that are great for a single vacation.

Great Travel Destinations for Singles

01. Taipei, Taiwan:

The night markets in Taipei are incredible. All you need is an appetite and you’ll be completely satisfied with all of the street-food carts available to you. There are also some great hiking trails outside the city.

02. Portland, Oregon:

Portland has one of the best food cart tours you’ll ever find, and it’s inexpensive compared to other similar kinds of tours. Voodoo Donut is one place that you definitely should go. Once you’re completely full, take a stroll through Forest Park. It is one of the most beautiful places in the area, and you’ll get the chance to work off all those calories.

03. Toronto:

Did you know that Toronto has islands? Well it does. There are eight islands in connection with Toronto, and since there are no cars allowed on the islands, you’ll truly get a sense of peace. Once you’re ready to head back to civilization, visit the St. Lawrence Market, which is one of the best in the world.

04. Rio de Janeiro:

This is a place to go if you want to see some of the world’s most breathtaking landscapes. Hike up Sugarloaf Mountain and you’ll see beauty for miles. If the city is more your style, you can take in all the well-crafted architecture around the city. Churches, historic buildings, and museums are also great places to visit. And of course, you can’t visit Rio de Janeiro without spending a little time on the white sand beaches.

05. Dublin:

Look no further if you’re interested in expanding your education and culture. Dublin is the place for you. The number of museums in this city is staggering, and you’re certain to have an experience of a lifetime. After visiting all those museums, you’re sure to be hungry, so try out the local food. And don’t forget to visit the Guinness Storehouse. It has all the beer you could possibly imagine.

06. Bangkok:

The Buddhist culture is a huge presence in this city, so anyone seeking a little spiritual guidance would fit right into this city. The temples are always open, and you can see the city on foot and explore the waterways on local boats. This is a slow-paced city, great for a relaxing vacation for one.

07. San Francisco, California:

Brunch is the best way to experience this city. Eat at all the local cafes and restaurants, and then check out the Golden Gate Park.

@graph.name: DevFarswan
@graph.description: Param Dass, works with Namaste India Trip. An avid travel enthusiast by nature, he brings his characteristic zeal and sincerity to all projects he involves himself in. His videography and photography reflect his urge to help fellow travelers who embrace the pleasures and perils of journeys just for the sense of adventure and newness they bring to our otherwise monotonous lives.
